documentation.text:
@dev | Shyft Conduit
      |
      | conduit
      | /knd(y)oot/
      | 1. a channel for conveying water or other fluid.
      |
      | conterminous
      | /kntrmns/
      | 1. sharing a common boundary.
      |
      | This contract manages the Shyft inflation organization and delegation to an Administrable distribution by value.
      | Because the block reward never changes (only the difficulty parameter), there is no really complex math involved.
      |
      | We use linked lists for the Conterminous linkages because in the case of a new array, the list can be easily
      | associated with the basic mappings without creating extra storage copies.
      | Contextually, any Conduit formed by means of a network inflation is unable to be laundered through any means other
      | than 100% network control. Network inflation is the purest of commodities, requiring physical resource production
      | to "game", making it a much higher fruit than existing means.
@dev Event for an conduit action that withdraws funds to itself only
@dev Event for fallback function of erc223 tokens.
@dev Event for other tokens' reversal of transfer.
@dev Event integrating an individual's account.
@dev Event for withdrawing to the user's own trusted account.
@dev event for withdrawing to native.
@dev event for withdrawing to an external contract.
@dev simple constant for a maximum 256 bit value.
@dev The array of erc223 token bundles.
@dev The current Shyft runtime inflation reward.
@dev The current Shyft staking pool reward.
@dev The current Shyft block reward
@dev Public address for the Shyft Distribution Contract address (block reward contract).
@dev Public address for the Shyft Kyc Contract Registry address.
@dev Mutex lock, prevent recursion in functions that use external function calls
@dev Modifier that checks for array length equality.
@dev Mapping for address to Conterminous account info.
@dev total count for number of Contermious accounts.
@dev conterminous address for first of the forward linked list.
@dev nonce for the "setConterminousDistributionAmounts" "_distributionKeyKeccak" input.
@dev Public Address for the Shyft Kyc Contract
@dev Public Address for the Prime Revocation Manager.
@dev Signature for triggering 'tokenFallback' in erc223 receiver contracts
@dev Signature from 'tokenFallback' sender in from kyc contract
@dev Kyc'd funds sent into this conduit manually.
@dev the origin (first) block that this contract was updated (distributed) to.
@dev Initializes the Conduit with the contract owner as the sender.

@dev Gets the current shyft block reward.
 @return result the current shyft block reward.

benefactorUpdateFunction(bytes,uint256).details: This function is called externally by an update pass that uses the voted-upon benefactor updates.

params._inflationAmount: The amount of inflation that is being sent per-block.
params._sigBytes: The bytes in the signature (in this function, unused).

returns.shouldUpdateBenefactor: whether or not the benefactor should be updated.
returns.updatedBenefactorAddress: if updating, what address is the benefactor being updated to.

callTokenReverseTransfer(uint256).details: This Erc223 token fallback mechanism associates assets to the proper address.

params._tokenIndex: The index for the return of erc223 tokens that were incorrectly sent to this address.

returns.result: | 0 = index is out of bounds     | 1 = token is not active     | 2 = msg.sender not permissioned to return tokens     | 3 = could not reverse token transfer     | 4 = successfully reversed token transfer

changeCurrentAdminConfirmationThreshold(.details: | This function takes in an index for a proposal ot change the current administrator confirmation threshold.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._proposalIndex: The index for a specific proposal to change the current administrator confirmation threshold.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = invalid proposal index    | 2 = not enough administrators to achieve confirmation threshold    | 3 = proposal has expired    | 4 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 5 = admin confirmation threshold set

checkConterminousLastBlockProcessed(addr.details: Checks a specific Conterminous address's last block that it has been integrated.

params._address: The public address of the Conterminous account.

returns.lastBlockProcessed: the last block processed in an integration cycle for this address.

checkConterminousWhiteShyftedBalance(add.details: Checks a specific Conterminous address's available balance from the inflationary pool.

params._address: The public address of the Conterminous account.

returns.balance: | 0 = no shyft kyc contract set    | 0 -> n = balance in shyft kyc contract for address

constructor.details: Initializes the Conduit with the contract owner as the sender.

getAdminAccess(address).details: Gets the level of access for a specific administrator.

returns.result: the level of access for this administrator

getAdminConfirmationProposal(uint32).details: Gets the components of a specific NofM change proposal.

returns.adminThreshold: the threshold of the NofM voting within this proposal
returns.endTime: the end time of this proposal, after which it cannot be voted on
returns.isCompleted: whether this proposal has been completed by multisig parties

getAdminConfirmationThreshold().details: Gets the NofM threshold currently required for passing multisig votes.

getAllConterminousInfos().details: Gets all conterminous information by traversing the linked list.

returns.result: all the conterminous informations from this generation.

getConterminousGeneration().details: Gets the current Conterminous Generation (# of times the current set of distribution participants have been updated).

returns.result: the current conterminous generation nonce
get a a specific conterminous information

getNumAdminConfirmationProposals().details: Gets the number of a specific NofM change proposal.

returns.result: the number of a specific NofM proposals

getNumErc223TokenBundles().details: Gets the number of Erc223 compatible token bundles that have been sent to this contract.

returns.result: the number of Erc223 compatible token bundles that have been sent to this contract.

getPermissionsForMultisignKey(bytes32).details: Gets whether there have been a specific number of multisignature confirmations for a specific vote.

params._keyKeccak: A hash to reference as the key/value vote subject.

returns.result: 0 to numAdministrators = #confirmations

getShyftBlockReward().details: Gets the current shyft block reward.

returns.result: the current shyft block reward.

integrateIndividualConterminousDistribut.details: This integrates all of the distributions for this specific Conterminous address.

params._conterminousAddress: The public address of the Conterminous account.

returns.result: | 0 = nothing to process    | 1 -> n = n blocks processed

isAdministrator(address).details: Returns whether a given address is an administrator.

params._administratorAddress: The public address of a specific administrator.

returns.result: | true = is administrator    | false = either administrator unset or demoted

isConfirmationsIsOverThreshold(uint256).details: Returns whether a reference number is over the system's administrator confirmation threshold (ie. the vote passes).

params._confirmationNumber: A number to reference as the confirmation number

returns.result: | true = is over threshold    | false = not over threshold

isPrimeRevocationManager(address).details: Gets whether the input address is actually the prime revocation manager.

params._primeRevocationManagerAddress: The public address of the potential prime revocation manager.

returns.result: | false = is not prime revocation manager address    | true = is prime revocation manager address

isValidConterminousAddress(address).details: Checks a specific Conterminous address's white list status (whether it's currently active in the distribution).

params._conterminousAddress: The public address of the Conterminous account.

returns.result: whether is address is whitelisted or not

promoteAdministrator(address).details: | Promotes a new administrator. If there is only a primary Administrator set, this will allow the addition of the second administrator and enable multisignature requirements for any actions of this contract (or those inheriting it).      | Uses Multi-signature permissions if there is more than one Administrator onboarded.

returns.result: | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = administrator already promoted    | 2 = new administrator promoted    | 3 = added vote to promote administrator

proposeChangeCurrentAdminConfirmationThr.details: This function proposes a change to the threshold of voting required (N signatories of M total set size = NofM). To prevent stale inattention results, timeout after 2 days.

params._newThreshold: The new threshold (N of M multisig) that is needed to be passed.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators to achieve confirmation threshold    | 2 = new proposal added

retrieveExternalFundsAfterDetach(address.details: | Sends external (sent to this contract re: receive function) funds to a specific address. *Only able to be done after this contract has been detached from a conduit flow*.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._recipient: The public address of the recipient of the external funds.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = assets sent to recipient address

revokeAdministrator(address).details: | Revokes an existing administrator from the multisignature set, checks to see if the # of required votes would be higher then the administrator set size, and if so adjusts to match.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions if there is more than one Administrator onboarded.

returns.result: result

setConterminousDistributionAmounts(addre.details: | This function takes in a keccak hash of all of the values, as well as the values themselves. It compares the hash of the values + the "generation" as a nonce, compares and returns whether it is approved. Then it compares the percentages and makes sure it all is <= 100%. Finally, it de-lists all existing addresses (with an integration beforehand), and then adds the new list in, within a linked-list structure.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._conterminousAddresses: The public addresses to which the assigned distribution can be claimed.
params._conterminousDistributionPercentages_lef: The percentage for this public address to be assigned (50, 40, 10, etc.)
params._distributionKeyKeccak: The percentage for this public address to be assigned (50, 40, 10, etc.)

returns.result: | 0 = all distribution percentages added together are over 100%    | 1 = conterminous integrations don't match    | 2 = more administrator confirmations required    | 3 = set conterminous distribution amounts

setConterminousDistributionAmountsPermis.details: | This function takes in a keccak hash of all of the values (n/100%) that are shifted to the left by 24. (2 ^ 24 - 1) = 16777215.      | this is to apply granularity to the distribution values of 1 in (2 ^ 24) wei equivalents.      | http://x86asm.net/articles/fixed-point-arithmetic-and-tricks/      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._distributionKeyKeccak: The distribution key keccak that is being voted on for the Conterminous distributions.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = ready to set conterminous distributions

setPrimaryAdministrator(address).details: Sets the primary Administrator for this contract (or those that inherit from it). This transfers ownership of this contracts first administration duties (to find and onboard a second party for multisignature requirements) to the set Administrator's public address.

returns.result: | 0 = not owner    | 1 = already set first administrator    | 2 = setup first administrator

setPrimeRevocationManagerAddress(address.details: | Sets the Prime Revocation Manager, the address with the ability to remove stale attestations.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._primeRevocationManagerAddress: The public address of the prime revocation manager.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = prime revocation manager set

setShyftKycContractAddress(address).details: | Sets the shyft kyc contract that will be used throughout the rest of the function calls.      | The Shyft Kyc Registry Contract address must be set before this function will call properly.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._shyftKycContractAddress: The smart contract address of the Shyft Kyc Contract.

returns.result: | 0 = not a valid kyc contract address    | 1 = not an administrator    | 2 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = set kyc contract address

setShyftKycContractRegistryAddress(addre.details: | Sets the shyft kyc contract registry for purposes of making sure that trusted assets are routed across Trust Channels that only existing Shyft Kyc Contract (versions) can honour.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._shyftKycContractRegistryAddress: The smart contract address of the Shyft Kyc Contract Registry.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = kyc contract registry address set

setSystemDistributionContractAddress(add.details: | Sets the system distribution (block reward) contract that this conduit is receiving funds from.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._systemDistributionContractAddress: The smart contract address that the block reward is being distributed from.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = system distribution contract address set

tokenFallback(address,uint256,bytes).details: This Erc223 token fallback mechanism associates assets to the proper address.

params._data: An external bytes mechanism to pass function signatures et al. to this fallback for processing.
params._from: The address that the token fallback is designating to receive assets.

returns.ok: the results from the function (should be "true", or else a revert condition)

updateStep(address,uint256).details: | This function (called by the block reward system-owned distribution contract) updates the current state, we also have admin controls that are triggered here to update the benefactor (target of the system distribution contract) to another.      | Openethereum style block reward return calls are used.      | There is also a Conterminous system-wide integration call performed, which can be a functionality set or not by the administrators of this contract.

params._inflationAmount: The incoming inflation amount (should match up with local understanding)
params._originalAddress: The original address that was used for the conterminous distribution cycle.

returns.preUpdateBenefactorExContractAddress: what address the update step needs to call
returns.preUpdateBenefactorExForwardedBytes: what, if any, forwarded bytes need to be sent to that other contract
returns.preUpdateBenefactorStepRequired: whether the benefactor update step is required
returns.success: the success result of this function.

voteAdminShouldIntegrateConterminousDist.details: | This function votes on the topic of whether to integrate the distributions on an update step (triggered from the block reward contract).      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._shouldIntegrateOnDistributionOnUpdate: Whether the conterminous addresses should be integrated on an update step.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = set whether the conterminous distributions should integrate on an update step

voteAdminShouldRemoveBenefactorPermanent.details: | This function votes on the topic of whether to the benefactor should be removed permanently.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._shouldRemovePermanently: Whether the benefactor should be removed permanently.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = set whether the benefactor (ie this contract) should be removed permanently from the distribution cycle

voteAdminShouldUpdateBenefactor(bool).details: | This function votes on the topic of whether to allow for a benefactor to be updated.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._shouldUpdateBenefactor: Whether the benefactor should be allowed to be updated.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = set whether the benefactor should be updated (to be removed permanently or for the benefactor target address to be updated)

voteAdminUpdateBenefactorAddressTarget(a.details: | This function votes on the topic of what address the benefactor should be updated to.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._adminUpdateBenefactorAddressTarget: What address the benefactor should be updated to.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = set that the benefactor update should happen and target is the address agreed upon

withdrawIndividualConterminousDistributi.details: This withdraws distribution from an existing Conterminous account to an external contract address, with a token fallback (erc223) address. 30,000 gas limit hardcoded.

params._contractAddress: The public address of the contract that assets are being transferred to.
params._value: The value of the distribution that should be sent to this address.

returns.ok: | false = not a contract address    | true = withdraw to contract successful

withdrawIndividualConterminousDistributi.details: This withdraws distribution from an existing Conterminous account to a regular payable public address.

params._to: The public address of the recipient.
params._value: The value of the distribution that should be sent to this address.

returns.ok: | false = not a native account    | true = withdraw to native account successfu

withdrawIndividualConterminousDistributi.details: this only withdraws to any registered ShyftKycContract. this function can *only* be called with the message sender receiving the balance in their Kyc Contract.

params._gasToSend: The amount of gas to send to this contract (30,000 suffices for the current shyft kyc contract calls.)
params._shyftKycContractAddress: The public address of the shyft kyc contract.
params._value: The value of the distribution that should be sent through this kyc contract address.

returns.result: | 0 = is not a registered kyc contract    | 2 = transfer was successful

withdrawSafeFundsToSelfOnlyTrustRouted(u.details: | From an external Verified Shyft Kyc Contract (that has been set previously by administrators), move native fuel tokens from that verified contract's account balance that belongs to this Conduit instance.      | Used in the case of funds not being sent directly from a block reward instance.

params._amount: The amount of native tokens that the caller is making available to this Shyft Conduit instance.

returns.result: | 0 = does not have available balance    | 1 = did not withdraw    | 2 = transfer successful

MAX_256.details: simple constant for a maximum 256 bit value.

adminShouldRemoveBenefactorPermanently.details: variable that controls whether benefactor should be removed permanently.

adminShouldUpdateBenefactor.details: variable that controls whether benefactor can be updated.

adminUpdateBenefactorAddressTarget.details: variable that controls what new address the benefactor will be set to.

allConterminousInfo.details: Mapping for address to Conterminous account info.

allErc223TokenBundles.details: The array of erc223 token bundles.

conterminousCount.details: total count for number of Contermious accounts.

conterminousZerothAddress.details: conterminous address for first of the forward linked list.

integrateConterminousDistributionsOnUpda.details: variable that controls whether the conterminous distributions integrate on an update call (from the block reward contract).

locked.details: Mutex lock, prevent recursion in functions that use external function calls

manualKycFundsAdded.details: Kyc'd funds sent into this conduit manually.

originBlockNumber.details: the origin (first) block that this contract was updated (distributed) to.

primeRevocationManagerAddress.details: Public Address for the Prime Revocation Manager.

runtimeInflationReward.details: The current Shyft runtime inflation reward.

shyftConduitSig.details: Signature for triggering 'tokenFallback' in erc223 receiver contracts

shyftKycContractAddress.details: Public Address for the Shyft Kyc Contract

shyftKycContractRegistryAddress.details: Public address for the Shyft Kyc Contract Registry address.

shyftKycContractSig.details: Signature from 'tokenFallback' sender in from kyc contract

stakingPoolReward.details: The current Shyft staking pool reward.

systemDistributionContractAddress.details: Public address for the Shyft Distribution Contract address (block reward contract).

callTokenReverseTransfer(uint256).notice: as the erc223 spec does not define return codes, I'm assuming that any contracts that care in the future about getting assets returned to them can use specific codes + lookup values to do the proper behaviour in a relatively plain-text manner, where you could have a lookup table of various assorted (common) functionalities.

changeCurrentAdminConfirmationThreshold(.notice: Multiple proposals can be constructed for different sets to apply to change the administrator threshold. As the permissions for multisig keys use a voting set nonce underneath the hood, a change in the current administrator set will cancel all current votes.

externalFundsBalance().notice: | There are three ways the Conduit can receive funds:      | 1) by proxy via the kyc contract it's linked to, which can be set up to only receive kyc'd funds.      | 2) by manual transfer of funds.      | 3) by the Shyft network inflation (or similar mechanisms).

getPermissionsForMultisignKey(bytes32).notice: Uses composition features (based on current validator set) so data structure may be orphaned when promotion/demotion events occur.

promoteAdministrator(address).notice: | Uses composition features (based on current validator set) so data structure may be orphaned when promotion/demotion events occur.         | Whenever this function is called (with a passing vote), there will be a re-hashing of the voting set nonce, so all current votes will become invalidated.

revokeAdministrator(address).notice: | Uses composition features (based on current validator set) so data structure may be orphaned when promotion/demotion events occur.         | Whenever this function is called (with a passing vote), there will be a re-hashing of the voting set nonce, so all current votes will become invalidated.

setConterminousDistributionAmounts(addre.notice: In the ui that would manage this component, the _distributionKeyKeccak should be the keccak256 of all of the addresses and distribution percentages, along with the current "conterminousGeneration", acting as a nonce.

setConterminousDistributionAmountsPermis.notice: In the UI that would manage this component, the _distributionKeyKeccak should be the keccak256 of all of the addresses and distribution percentages, along with the current "conterminousGeneration", acting as a nonce.

updateStep(address,uint256).notice: This function should only ever be called by the block reward contract, if it exists.

withdrawIndividualConterminousDistributi.notice: it's assumed that there will be a mechanism where the receiver knows (& has whitelisted) this contract and the associated withdrawal function signature (shyftConduitSig) and will properly allocate assets based on that.

withdrawSafeFundsToSelfOnlyTrustRouted(u.notice: This function does *not* need to be called when there is a block reward instance distributing native fuel tokens.If the Kyc contract instance has ever been sent a message by this Conduit contract instance to have their account only accept Trusted assets, then this flow can be considered completely Kyc'd, as the Trust Channel routing will be enforced.
